text: the Italian deputy health minister
Pierre Paolo Soleri says that he
believes Italy is currently experiencing
the peak of the corona virus outbreak
more than 10,000 people have died there
the highest death toll anywhere in the
world he told the BBC that the country
might see a drop in the death rate in a
week or 10 days time mr. selary was
speaking to the BBC's Andrew Marr I
believe the lockdown starts to work I
mean we started locked down at the
middle of March I mean we did start with
the first lockdown between the 8th and
the 9th of March so obviously to wait at
least 14 17 18 days after death to see
the reduction of number of affected
people over the last few days we had an
increase of infection and this was due
to the increase of this lab that had
been performed so we are looking we are
searching more and obviously we have
more resource of positive people mainly
with low without symptoms I'm sorry can
I ask you to explain exactly what has
changed you think over the last two
three days we start to do more swab
especially to trace and we are testing
more exactly and obviously when you test
more you you may found more positive
people and this will explain the the
increased number of positive that we
found over the last two days but I
believe that we are living in the peak
of this epidemia I believe in one week
time 10 days maximum we will see a drop
it's an easy drop of positive cases
that's the Italian Health Minister

approve these new restrictions they will

mean essentially non-essential workers
these are for instance construction
workers postal workers people working on
production lines which don't relate to
the epidemic
for instance car workers some opticians
and even people running shops that are
not related to food they will not be
allowed to go to work for the next two
weeks and will have to stay at home the
government is saying that they are
cheered to some extent by the fact that

may be what the government is saying but
it seems that actually the problem is

because there's a letter there's a

that all parties in the war-torn country
must stop fighting to avoid further

says that Syria's health system has been
acutely weakened by years of conflict in
the country the US President Donald
Trump has backed away from imposing a

was considering the move instead
residents are being strongly advised
against non-essential travel

president Trump told reporters he was

it says the advice does not apply to

Freyja Cole BBC News South Korea says

down
now when it comes to self isolation the

that they've introduced is that
passengers in all flights coming to

a temperature check if they don't they
will not be allowed on the flight nope
South Korean authorities are coming
